content.text: She spent \(\frac{1}{8}\) of this on food
Calculate how much she spent on food
Calculate how much she paid in taxes

Calculate how much Lucy earned in the previous week

Calculate the value of the women's clothes she sold

Calculate the total value of the clothes sold in the shop on this day
The shop sells clothes for men, women and children
Lucy works in a clothes shop
Draw the reflection of shape \(X\) in the \(x\)-axis. Label the image \(Y.\)
Draw the rotation of shape \(\mathbf{Y}\), \(90^{\circ}\) clockwise about (0, 0). Label the image \(Z.\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps shape \(Z\) onto shape \(X.\)

Find the matrix which represents an enlargement, centre (0, 0), scale factor \(\frac{1}{2}\)

Find the matrix which represents a shear with the \(x\)-axis invariant and shear factor \(-1.\)
Calculate the acute angle between the diagonals of the rectangle
The diagram shows a square of side \((x + 5)\mathrm{cm}\) and a rectangle which measures \(2x\mathrm{cm}\) by \(x\mathrm{cm}\)
The area of the square is \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) more than the area of the rectangle

The circle, centre \(O\), passes through the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\)

Use the tangent to estimate the gradient of the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) where \(x = - 1.5\)

Draw a suitable line on the grid and use your graphs to solve the equation \(x^{2} + \frac{1}{x^{2}} = 2x.\)

The results are shown in the cumulative frequency diagram above

A plant is chosen at random
Find the probability that it will **not** produce a yellow flower

Katrina puts some plants in her garden
The probability that a plant will produce a flower is \(\frac{7}{10}\)
If there is a flower, it can only be red, yellow or orange
When there is a flower, the probability it is red is \(\frac{2}{3}\) and the probability it is yellow is \(\frac{1}{4}\)
